lyrics.text: Lesson 48. Did you want to tell me something?
lyrics.translation: 第48课。你想告诉我一些事情吗？

lyrics.text: First listen and then answer the question.
lyrics.translation: 首先听录音，然后回答问题。

lyrics.text: Why did the writer become very worried?
lyrics.translation: 为什么作家变得非常担心？

lyrics.text: Dentists always ask questions when it is impossible for you to answer.
lyrics.translation: 牙医总是在你无法回答的时候问问题。

lyrics.text: My dentist had just pulled out one of my teeth and had told me to rest for a while.
lyrics.translation: 我的牙医刚刚拔掉了我的一颗牙齿，并告诉我要休息一会儿。

lyrics.text: I tried to say something, but my mouth was full of cotton wool.
lyrics.translation: 我试图说些什么，但我的嘴里塞满了棉絮。

lyrics.text: He knew I collected match boxes and asked me whether my collection was growing.
lyrics.translation: 他知道我收集火柴盒，并问我我的收藏是否在增加。

lyrics.text: He then asked me how my brother was and whether I liked my new job in London.
lyrics.translation: 然后他问我我哥哥怎么样，以及我是否喜欢我在伦敦的新工作。

lyrics.text: In answer to these questions, I either nodded or made strange noises.
lyrics.translation: 对于这些问题，我要么点头要么发出奇怪的声音。

lyrics.text: Meanwhile, my tongue was busy searching out the hole where the tooth had been.
lyrics.translation: 与此同时，我的舌头正忙着寻找那颗牙齿曾经所在的地方。

lyrics.text: I suddenly felt very worried but could not say anything.
lyrics.translation: 我突然感到很担心，但什么也说不出来。

lyrics.text: When the dentist at last removed the cotton wool from my mouth,
lyrics.translation: 当牙医最后从我嘴里取出棉球时，

lyrics.text: I was able to tell him that he had pulled out the wrong tooth.
lyrics.translation: 我能够告诉他，他拔错了牙。
